descr.p: The URIParser unit contains a basic type () and some routines for the parsing () and construction () of Uniform Resource Indicators, commonly referred to as URL: Uniform Resource Location. It is used in various other units, and in itself contains no classes. It supports all protocols, username/password/port specification, query parameters and bookmarks etc..

topic.name: Basic URI Parsing
topic.short: Basic usage of URI parsing functions

descr.p: The URIParser unit provides simple functions to parse and construct URIs. The main function is ParseURI which parses a URI string into a TURI record containing all the components.

Key functions in the URIParser unit:

ul.li: ParseURI - Parses a URI string into components
EncodeURI - Reconstructs a URI string from components
ResolveRelativeURI - Resolves relative URIs against a base URI
URIToFilename - Converts file URIs to local filenames
FilenameToURI - Converts local filenames to file URIs
IsAbsoluteURI - Checks if a URI is absolute (has a protocol)

element.name: TURI
element.short: Record containing all possible parts of a URI.
element.descr: TURI is the basic record that can be filled by the call. It contains the contents of a URI, parsed out in it's various pieces.

element.name: TURI.Protocol
element.short: Protocol of the URI (http, ftp, file, mailto etc.).

element.name: TURI.Username
element.short: Username part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Password
element.short: Password part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Host
element.short: Hostname part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Port
element.short: Port part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Path
element.short: Path (directory) part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Document
element.short: Document (filename) part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Params
element.short: Query parameter part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.Bookmark
element.short: Bookmark part of the URI.

element.name: TURI.HasAuthority
element.short: Indicates whether an 'Authority' part was present in the URI.

element.name: EncodeURI
element.short: Form a string representation of the URI.
element.descr: EncodeURI will return a valid text representation of the URI in the URI record.

element.name: EncodeURI.Result
element.short: The text representation of the URI.

element.name: EncodeURI.URI
element.short: The URI record to encode.

element.name: ParseURI
element.short: Parse a URI and split it into its constituent parts.

descr.p: ParseURI decodes URI and returns the various parts of the URI in the result record.
The function accepts the most general URI scheme:

Missing (optional) parts in the URI will be left blank in the result record. If a default protocol and port are specified, they will be used in the record if the corresponding part is not present in the URI.

element.name: ParseURI.Result
element.short: Record type with the component values for the URI.

element.name: ParseURI.URI
element.short: String with the URI to parse in the routine.

element.name: ParseURI.Decode
element.short: Indicates if encoded (escaped) values in the string are decoded in the routine. Default is True.

element.name: ParseURI.DefaultProtocol
element.short: Default protocol to use if none is specified.

element.name: ParseURI.DefaultPort
element.short: Default port to use if none is specified.

element.name: ResolveRelativeURI
element.short: Return a relative link.

descr.p: ResolveRelativeURI returns in ResultUri an absolute link constructed from a base URI BaseURI and a relative link RelURI. One of the two URI names must have a protocol specified. If the RelURI argument contains a protocol, it is considered a complete (absolute) URI and is returned as the result.
The function returns True if a link was successfully returned.

element.errors: If no protocols are specified, the function returns False

element.name: ResolveRelativeURI.Result
element.short: True if the operation was successful, False if not.

element.name: ResolveRelativeURI.BaseUri
element.short: Base URI.

element.name: ResolveRelativeURI.RelUri
element.short: URI relative to BaseURI or absolute URI.

element.name: ResolveRelativeURI.ResultUri
element.short: Resulting absolute URI.

element.name: URIToFilename
element.short: Convert a URI to a filename.
element.descr: URIToFilename returns a filename (using the correct Path Delimiter character) from URI. The URI must be of protocol File or have no protocol.
element.errors: If the URI contains an unsupported protocol, False is returned.

element.name: URIToFilename.Result
element.short: True if a filename was extracted from the URI.

element.name: URIToFilename.URI
element.short: URI to analyse.

element.name: URIToFilename.Filename
element.short: Resulting filename.

element.name: FilenameToURI
element.short: Construct a URI from a filename.
element.descr: FilenameToURI takes Filename and constructs a file: protocol URI from it.

element.name: FilenameToURI.Result
element.short: file: protocol URI.

element.name: FilenameToURI.Filename
element.short: Filename to construct URI from.

element.name: FilenameToURI.Encode
element.short: True if invalid Path characters in FileName are encoded (escaped) in the URI.

element.name: IsAbsoluteURI
element.short: Check whether a URI is absolute.
element.descr: IsAbsoluteURI returns True if the URI in UriReference is absolute, i.e. contains a protocol part.

element.name: IsAbsoluteURI.Result
element.short: True if UriReference is absolute.

element.name: IsAbsoluteURI.UriReference
element.short: URI to analyse.
